headline: Momma's Healthy Meatloaf
description: This healthy meatloaf recipe with extra-lean ground beef, carrots, onion, zucchini, and bell pepper will become a family favorite weeknight dinner.
name: Momma's Healthy Meatloaf
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir green bell pepper and onion in hot oil until onion is transparent and bell pepper is softened, 5 to 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove the skillet from heat.
Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, carrot, zucchini, eggs, salt, pepper, and bell pepper mixture in a large bowl; mix well using your hands. Press meat mixture into the prepared loaf pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 35 to 40 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Spread ketchup on top of meatloaf and continue baking until bubbling, about 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: I loved it so much. My alterations: I used celery instead of zucchini and panko breadcrumbs instead of whole wheat and lean ground beef instead of extra lean.

I made this for my family and they liked it. I would add more garlic next time, and grate the carrots finer to mix better with the other ingredients. I used 1 and 1/4 cup Panko breadcrumbs as that's what I had on hand. I would have rated 5 stars but it took much longer to get up to the proper internal temperature, an extra 15 minutes at least at 400. I would try cooking at 425 for the first half next time. Yes, my oven is usually quite hot. I also added a bit of salt-free chicken seasoning to the onions and peppers when I was sauteing them in the first step. I didn't use oil to fry veggies either, as it's already got enough fat from the meat. Leave yourself at least 1.5 hours just in case you need more cooking time. Great recipe for added veggies though, as it's still a solid meatloaf. Serves 4 hungry men.

My husband and even my very picky kids loved this (and they don't like eggs or veggies!)! I soaked homemade breadcrumbs in 3% milk, and added an extra egg since I used just a little more than 1 lb of lean meat. Instead of lean beef, combined half ground pork with half ground chicken breast. We all love garlic in this house so next time I'll be doubling the amount of garlic. Adding this to my favourite comfort food recipes from now on.
Made as is. Loved the combination of vegetables. Will definitely make again.
Awesome meatloaf recipe. Very moist and delicious!
it was good

This is an outstanding recipe and even my picky husband loved it! Didn’t have any carrots so just increased the amounts of the other veggies. Also substituted gluten-free quick oats for the bread crumbs. Absolutely loved it!

The best meatloaf I’ve ever had and even messed up the recipe! Added regular breadcrumbs instead and a little Parmesan cheese to the mix, did not cook the bell pepper before. Paired with sweet potato mash.
I had to cook it about 45 minutes but it was excellent! I will make this again.

Great recipe! I did change some things. Less bell pepper, a little less carrot (because carrot flavor can take over. I had that happen making chili once so I'm cautious now.) And 1/4 less bread crumbs. I used worcestershire sauce, thyme, oregano, a lil chicken broth, and tomato sauce instead of ketchup. And I used 90% lean beef. I think that's about all I changed. It came out very well. The carrot was identifiable but not too strong. Couldn't even taste the zucchini.
Vegetables really helped maintain moistness. Great taste, a keeper!

This is the best meatloaf recipe..and easy too! I used meatloaf mix from the butcher which i think is beef and pork and I omitted the zucchini. I doubled the recipe and froze the other one. Its delicious!

This turned out wonderful! I’m not big on meatloaf, but was looking for something to make with my ground deer. I used 3/4 pound of meat because that’s what I had. I also think more garlic would be good. So many vegetables mixed in this and you can’t tell!
Super yummy and super easy

I made this meatloaf, my family enjoyed it. It was moist and flavorful, I will definitely make it again. I used 4 lbs of meat. I stuck with this recipe bug added these. I added celery, 1 more egg, 2 teaspoons of Worcestershire sauce, oregano, thyme, black pepper, parsley & rosemary. I added some olive oil to the meat so it doesn’t get dry. It came out good.
WOW! This is the moistest, most delicious meatloaf recipe I have ever tasted. Kudos to " Momma".
Love the recipe, even better my guys love the meatloaf. One change I made was with the topping. I made a mixture with ketchup, chutney and BBQ sauce and then rebaked it.
Perfect!! A must try. Ignore the bad reviews, some simply cannot season to taste.
I've used this recipe several times and follow the directions exactly. I especially like the carrots. Perfect every time.
Love this recipe....Make it frequently, and its a HIT!

Needs more spice. I used orange bell pepper, celery and sweet potato instead of green pepper, carrots and zucchini, added fresh baby spinach, threw all the veggies in the processor to avoid kids picking out chunks, used 4 cloves garlic and added garlic powder and a little Worcestershire and it still needed more flavor. I used 3 mini loaf pans to cook faster but it still took 35-40 minutes. Good recipe and easy to sneak in lots of veggies.

Loved it. I am trying to lose weight right now and this recipe fit what I am able to eat right now and it was SOOOO delicious. It was nice to have a break from fish and salads and enjoy a "comfort" food. I didn't have the right size loaf pan, so I made it in an 8x8 glass dish at 380 degrees since another commenter mentioned it being too dry. I cooked it for 35 minutes and then added the ketchup for another 5 minutes and it was moist and fantastic. Definitely recommended.
I had to bake it about 20 minutes longer than stated and I had to omit the garlic due to an allergy. This is good though.
I had to bake it about 20 minutes longer than stated and I had to omit the garlic due to an allergy. This is good though.

I decided to sort of double the recipe as I had 1 3/4 lbs of a meatloaf mix I wanted to use. I didn't have double of everything and I made a few subs but it was still delicious! I subbed finely chopped broccoli for the green pepper (1 cup), I added a half a cup of some cremini mushrooms I had and used yellow squash instead of zucchini. I didn't have ketchup but we used bbq sauce on half of it to try and it gave it a nice kick. Very moist!

I like to double this and use half ground turkey, half buffalo. Instead of ketchup on top I often use barbecue sauce or a mix of the two for a bit more flavor. It tends to fall apart easily but tastes great.

What a delicious meatloaf jammed full of veggies that I normally cannot get hubby to eat! The only thing I would do is add more of a ketchup/barbecue topping on this, 1/4 cup ketchup was just not enough of a topping. Will turn that rating into a 5 from me with that change. Looking forward to leftovers.
Really good tasting meatloaf. It’s a keeper and. Now a staple on our me u!

I love this recipe mainly because it's the best way to get my baby to eat meat and vegetables. I also like the texture; it's moist and stays together really well. Three out of four of us in our family like the taste; my 10-year-old thinks it tastes too much like vegetables.

Tasty and healthy! It’s a win win... for the adults and the kids. I used ground turkey 93/7. Also double ketchup... half in the loaf and half on top as specified. I also used Panko bread crumbs which were on hand. It’s a keeper!

I thought this was very bland. I don't think I put enough salt in, but how is one supposed to season raw meat "to taste?" A more specific measurement would probably have been helpful. It was moist and a good texture, anyway. I might try again, but would have to add at least more salt and probably some other seasoning as well.
Used red pepper instead of green. Next time will only bake for 35 mins instead of 40 as it was a bit dry.
great meatloaf

author.name: Phu kien vach ngan ve sinh THM

review.reviewBody: good
Had to make a bigger meat loaf but it turned out great!!
I forgot the zucchini so I added more onions and peppers to kind of make up for it and it was really good! Though the meat was a little dry when it was done. Technical error on my part.
I only had one carrot worth of shredded carrot and I added barbecue sauce to the mix. The whole family enjoyed it.

Absolutely loved it! Very healthy option!
Next time I would probably add a little salt seasoning of some sort. Maybe a touch of cajun space to kick up the flavor a little more
Zucchini, Worcester sauce, ketchup , and brown sugar . Actually doubled the recipe so we could feed everyone, added twice baked loaded potatoes.
I didn’t make any changes and my family loved it. I will add this to my favorite recipes.

I made this exactly as written. It was delicious, and I liked that it was also healthy. The carrot & the green bell pepper added a tasty & interesting flavor which we loved. This is my new go-to Meatloaf recipe. Thanx NOLAMom :-)
Very nice. Great left over. Swapped out the zucchini with mushrooms and added a teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce to the mix and it came out well.
I have never made meatloaf before and this was an easy and very delicious recipe. I will be making this again. My husband love it also.
Easy and tasty
All I did differently was add a little Heinz 57 sauce.

I essentially followed the recipe but with an addition of Worcestershire sauce (or powder) and some Montreal Steak seasoning. It was great! The other thing is that our extended family never uses catsup on meatloaf. It is always spaghetti sauce and we pour that on top right before going into the oven. Then we add additional 10 minutes before removing from the oven. My suggestion is to allow it to test 10 minutes covered before serving to keep it even more moist. We also have hot spaghetti sauce available at the table for those who want to top their slice with more of that Italian goodness.

I followed the recipe exactly but doubled the recipe and used ground turkey. It was amazing! Pretty much the best meatloaf we’ve had! Definitely a keeper. Next time, I will try to alter by removing the breadcrumbs only because we are gluten-free sensitive. Otherwise, this is a huge hit and will be incorporated into our frequent dinner schedule. Thanks for providing such a healthy family favorite!!

Absolutely delicious! Will always use this recipe - it was so moist and so healthy. Added sundried tomatoes as well.
Thank you, thank you! Jackie ( Canada)
Fantastic! I added a bit of celery and onion soup mix instead of salt. The whole family loved it!
Excellant with spinach, onions, peppers, mushrooms, and spices

Great recipe. Followed to a T except I didn’t include the veggies minus the onions. Also found that I had to bake about20 minutes longer than listed. This could be because of my oven. Nonetheless, a wonderful meatloaf recipe. Remember to add a can of diced tomatoes, crushed red peppers to taste, and a dash of A-1 sauce.
Love, love, love this recipe! Enjoyed the incorporation of all the different veggies. We served it alongside a side salad and roasted asparagus...yum!
It came out very delicious. My wife and I enjoyed it. Thank you for the recipe.
did not take photo. Did not want to wast time. I eat it right away.
Excellent recipe, the best meatloaf ever.
Made exactly as written and it was delicious!! I’ve played around with different glazes versus plain ketchup, everything tastes great on it!
Nice and moist. I left out the bread crumbs and doubled the meat, as the veggies were taking over, and made two loaves instead of 1
Husband and 11 year old daughter loves this recipe. Added about 1 T of Worchestire sauce as recommended by some other reviews. Very moist and yummy!
I doubled the recipe but used 1lb burger and 1lb turkey and add some liquid smoke. Everyone loved it
Delicious! I would add about 1/2-1tsp of salt. I cooked at 350 convection for 45 min. And used steel cut oatmeal instead of bread crumbs. Turned out great!

I'm not a novice cook, but this was transformational. I've been making meatloaf wrong for a few decades. I had a pound of ground chuck and sauteed all the veggies together (adding garlic in the last five mins.) I froze half the veggies and put the rest in the meat; added my homemade whole grain toasted bread; stirred and stirred and baked. It was perfect. My husband who claims not to like cooked carrots, bell pepper at all (I used an orange bell pepper), and zucchini only with cheese on it, loved it. I will make this again using ground sirloin with all the veggies or a combo of ground chuck and ground turkey with all the veggies. Well done, NOLAMom!
It was really good and everyone enjoyed it! Most even went back for seconds.
Really enjoyed it! Liked the addition of the vegetables. Will definitely make it again.

I made this a while back. It had been many years since I had made a meatloaf, but this really impressed me and my family! Our taste buds sang their own song to the deliciousness of the ingredients that went into this meatloaf! It was just perfect, I changed nothing! This is such a great recipe! Thank you.

I made this a while back. It had been many years since I had made a meatloaf, but this really impressed me and my family! Our taste buds sang their own song to the deliciousness of the ingredients that went into this meatloaf! It was just perfect, I changed nothing! This is such a great recipe! Thank you.

This did not turn out well for me. The taste was okay, a little bland. I added more garlic to it for flavor. With all of the vegetables in this loaf it did not hold its "loaf" shape at all. I took it out of my loaf pan and let it rest for a while but as soon as I cut it the whole thing just broke apart.

Delicious!! I couldn't find whole wheat bread crumbs, so I used plain, but everything else the recipe listed, I used. I believe it is the tastiest meatloaf I have ever made .... and as leftovers it made great sandwiches! (I made a double recipe.)

I knew it would be too plain without any seasonings whatsoever, so I added 1 tsp garlic salt, 1 tsp black pepper, and 1/2 tsp of paprika. it was so amazing! the flavors just blended beautifully and it felt so much lighter than traditional, greasy meatloaf. the kids loved it; it's a new favorite!
I used turkey instead of beef and added brown sugar to the ketchup, this recipe is so good, I don’t even like regular meatloaf anymore!

This was great! It wasn't a super huge loaf even though I used an extra half pound of ground beef (adjusted the ingredients accordingly). It's just my husband and I but we wanted leftovers for sandwiches. It slices very nice, doesn't fall apart, so it will work well ! It's a good recipe for tweaking to your personal tastes. My tweaks were: I used my own homemade dry bread crumbs, added teaspoon or so of poultry seasoning, baked it 350 for 1 hour 20 min. (to 160 degrees). I made a topping out of ketchup, barbecue sauce and a little nutmeg and put it on the last half hour.

I loved this because I don’t eat vegetables. And this way was very good and really unnoticeable but had a good taste. If that makes any sense. The only thing I added was brown sugar to the ketchup. I know not so healthy but something my mother always did.
Moist and tasty.

I enjoyed this meatloaf. I changed the green peppers, with a red pepper. I added a little olive oil, used the carrots, and zucchini.We were able to add more vegetables, for those that don't like vegetables. it was delicious.
Delicious, healthy and easy. Love that it used ingredients commonly on hand. Made no changes and will make again.
instead of bread I used crackers and didn't cook the onion and peppers ahead of time, due to the flavor is lost before it can get into the meatload.

Forget the ketchup and most vegetablrs. Drain a can of stewed tomatoes with garlic pepper and onion or Italian style canned tomatoes. Drain the canned tomatoes so that most liquid is out. Add to ground beef. Shape Into Loaf. Mix some brown sugar and ketchup together in a small bowl and spread over top of loaf. Cook as directed.

Made a triple batch as I had that much meat. Maybe multiplying so much of things like eggs and some of the veggies detracted but neither myself nor my son cared for this. The carrot and zucchini were overpowering both in taste and texture.
Had to use squash instead of zucchini, but thought it was delicious. Can't wait to make it again.
I added about 1/4 c of celery and used equal parts of beef and turkey. I will probably make it again. The real test will be how the leftover loaf tastes in sandwiches!
I thought it was alright. Pretty bland for my taste. My dad liked it though. Good healthy alternative

Made as the recipe stated. Needed to cook 20- 30 minutes longer than suggested. Would have been better on parchment paper in a loaf shape rather than in a loaf pan. I love vegetables but thought this was a little too vegetable forward for being a "meat " loaf.
I will definitely make this again. Love all the veggies incorporated into the mix. Leftovers were very good, too.

Trust, I followed the recipe as is!. It turned out well!!
Thanks so much for sharing the recipe online.
It helped out! Something easy, simple & enjoyable!!!. 
Much appreciation
Jasmin Peter

My husband insisted I save this recipe because he loved it so much. I followed everything exactly though I did add a shake of garlic powder because we like a lot of garlic. It came out amazing, super moist and you can't really taste any of the veggies, and for my anti veggie tongue that was super important. What you can taste is the bell pepper but it's one the only veggies I do like but if you have super picky kids I'd chop them super fine
Rich and very tender!

Made the following changes and found it to be moist, flavourful and amazing:
Used 4 cloves of garlic. Substituted zucchini with shredded sweet potato. Seasoned with a generous amount of Montreal steak seasoning and Worcestershire sauce. Glazed with a mixture of ketchup, Worcestershire, and brown sugar.
I will definitely be making this recipe again.
I didn't have bell peppers- would have been better with it- but still delicious! I glazed with ketchup & Karo syrup mixed together (my mom's glaze). I think this is the best way to top meatloaf. Yum!

My kids LOVED this recipe. even my five year old who would be a strong contender for world's pickiest eater said he wants this for dinner every day! I made it and sliced it, freezing two slices in each sandwich bag separated by wax paper. I take it out of the freezer the night before and put it in the fridge. Day of I warm the slices in my toaster oven and serve with some cucumber slices for a major time save meal that is nutritious.

So good! I added fresh chopped parsley and dry thyme and oregano. I also added brown sugar to the ketchup topping.
I substituted dried potato flakes for the flour to make it gluten free.
Everyone loved it! A saver!!
My family enjoyed the meatloaf very much. I will certainly make this recipe again.
Love this recipe. So good.

Added a little worcestershire and fresh Italian parsley, and as suggested by other reviewers, used 1/2 ketchup and 1/2 bbq sauce as the topping. It was good, may make it again, but didn't feel it was 5 stars. Thanks for a good healthy recipe.
Easy to make came out delicious. Added 1 package of onion soup mix as another cook suggested. Seasoned it perfectly!

I had 1.3 lb of meat so I used that and dropped the ketchup at the end because my husband isn't a fan. It took closer to 50 minutes for it to cook fully with the extra volume but came out perfectly moist and had tons of flavor. I will definitely be making this again and probably sticking with the slight changes.
really delish!!! super moist. added a bit of Worcester sauce and fresh garlic. used Turkey instead. loved the recipe!!! the family really enjoyed this dish..

This was very, very good. My kids loved it, too! I followed recipe exactly, except that I used Italian breadcrumbs because that's what I had on hand. I also added Heinz Sweet and Smoky BBQ sauce to the ketchup (1/2 ketchup, 1/2 BBQ sauce). I will be making it again and the leftovers were even better! Thank you!

I am not a big meatloaf fan. I added Wegman's sundried tomotoes and fresh Italian parsley and absolutely loved this recipe! Came out moist and delicious the entire family gave it 2-thumbs up including my 5-year old!
Very nice recipe. Meatloaf had lots of flavor and was very moist. Definitely will make this again.

I did not change this recipe except to add a bit of BBQ sauce to the ketchup as did a previous reviewer. Glad I did , as it added to the flavor. This meatloaf was moist and very good. It is a favorite.
